result.execSummary:
The defendant Leona A Givhan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Court will allow for early termination of probation after 6 months, if the Agent deems appropriate.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leona A Givhan

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Leona A Givhan in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
 WITHHELD SENTENCE.   
2 Day Credit - IF REVOKED.  

Term of Probation:  12 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Court will allow for early termination of probation after 6 months if the agent deems appropriate.
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed

Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Bail to be refunded to the posting party.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.


CONDITION TIME: 
30 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED -  to be used at agent's discretion. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Leona A Givhan in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Leona A Givhan in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to not commit any moving (driving) violations.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Leona A Givhan in court, in custody, with attorney Cameron Weitzner.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested   Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
